title: Guidelines for 'nurdle' transportation agreed after X-Press Pearl disaster - TradeWinds
summary: New stowage recommendations have been agreed upon in the wake of the X-Press Pearl container ship disaster off Sri Lanka, where lentil-sized nurdles were spilled into the ocean. Nurdles are the building blocks for plastic products and are often mistaken for food by marine life. They can break down into smaller microplastics and have a negative impact on the environment.

title: European Commission refuses to let the dust settle on the EU Taxonomy - Travers Smith
summary: The European Commission is planning to amend the existing Taxonomy on climate change mitigation and adaptation to include transitional activities with a focus on sustainable transport, such as the manufacture of components for low-carbon transport or the conversion of transport to lower-carbon alternatives. The amendments are planned to apply from 1 January 2024, with entities required to start reporting from 2024. The inclusion of transitional activities is controversial, as critics argue that it could lock in carbon-intensive assets for many years.
